auth_config.name: api_key
auth_config.label: OpenAI API Key
auth_config.message: This API key will be used for accessing OpenAI APIs.

messages.text: The messages to generate chat completions for; in the chat format

model.text: ID of the model to use.

frequency_penalty.text: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far; decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim

logit_bias.text: Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion

logprobs.text: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not

top_logprobs.text: An integer between 0 and 20 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability

max_tokens.text: The maximum number of tokens allowed for the generated answer. By default the number of tokens the model can return will be (4096 - prompt tokens)

n.text: How many chat completion choices to generate for each input message

presence_penalty.text: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far; increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics

response_format.text: An object specifying the format that the model must output

seed.text: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens

stream.text: If set; partial message deltas will be sent like in ChatGPT. Tokens will be sent as data-only server-sent events as they become available; with the stream terminated by a data - [DONE] message

temperature.text: What sampling temperature to use between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random; while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both

top_p.text: An alternative to sampling with temperature; called nucleus sampling; where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both

tools.text: A list of tools the model may call

tool_choice.text: Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model. none means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message

parallel_tool_calls.text: Whether to enable parallel function calling during tool use

user.text: A unique identifier representing your end-user which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse

meta.description:
Creates a completion for the chat message.


List of available models for ChatGPT API:  


`gpt-3.5-turbo` (Current)

`gpt-3.5-turbo-16k`

`gpt-3.5-turbo-instruct`


`gpt-4` 

`gpt-4-32k`

`gpt-4-1106-preview`

`gpt-4-vision-preview`


[Official OpenAI model here: https://platform.openai.com/docs/models](https://platform.openai.com/docs/models)

file.text: The audio file to transcribe in one of these formats
enum: mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, wav, or webm

model.text: ID of the model to use. Only whisper-1 is currently available

language.text: The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in ISO-639-1 format will improve accuracy and latency

prompt.text: An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should match the audio language

response_format.text: The format of the transcript output; in one of these options
enum: json; text; srt; verbose_json; or vtt

temperature.text: The sampling temperature; between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random; while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0; the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit

timestamp_granularities[].text: The timestamp granularities to populate for this transcription

meta.description: Transcribes audio into the input language

file.text: The audio file to transcribe in one of these formats
enum: mp3; mp4; mpeg; mpga; m4a; wav; or webm

model.text: ID of the model to use. Only whisper-1 is currently available

prompt.text: An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should match the audio language

response_format.text: The format of the transcript output; in one of these options
enum: json; text; srt; verbose_json; or vtt

temperature.text: The sampling temperature; between 0 and 1. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random; while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. If set to 0; the model will use log probability to automatically increase the temperature until certain thresholds are hit

meta.description: Translates audio into into English

prompt.text: Provide a text description of the desired image(s), with a maximum length of 1000 characters for DALL-E 2 and 4000 characters for DALL-E 3.

model.text: The model to use for image generation

n.text: Specify the number of images to generate, between 1 and 10; for DALL-E 3, only n=1 is supported.

quality.text: Specify the quality of the image; 'hd' creates images with finer details and greater consistency, supported only for DALL-E 3.

response_format.text: Specify the format of the generated images, either 'url' or 'b64_json'; URLs are valid for 60 minutes after generation.

size.text: Specify the size of the generated images: 256x256, 512x512, or 1024x1024 for DALL-E 2; 1024x1024, 1792x1024, or 1024x1792 for DALL-E 3.

style.text: Specify the style of the generated images, either 'vivid' for hyper-real and dramatic images or 'natural' for more natural, less hyper-real images, supported only for DALL-E 3.

user.text: Provide a unique identifier representing your end-user to help OpenAI monitor and detect abuse.

meta.description: Creates an image given a prompt

image.text: Provide the image to edit, which must be a valid PNG file, less than 4MB, and square; if no mask is provided, the image must have transparency to be used as the mask

prompt.text: Provide a text description of the desired image(s) within a maximum length of 1000 characters

mask.text: Provide an additional image where fully transparent areas (alpha zero) indicate where edits should be applied, valid as a PNG file, less than 4MB, and matching the dimensions of the main image

model.text: Specify the model for image generation; only DALL-E 2 is supported at this time

n.text: The number of images to generate. Must be between 1 and 10

size.text: The size of the generated images. Must be one of 256x256, 512x512, or 1024x1024

response_format.text: Specify the format for the generated images: 'url' or 'b64_json'. URLs are valid for 60 minutes after generation

user.text: Provide a unique identifier representing your end-user to help OpenAI monitor and detect abuse.

meta.description: Creates an edited or extended image given an original image and a prompt

image.text: The image to use as the basis for the variation(s). Must be a valid PNG file, less than 4MB, and square

model.text: The model to use for image generation. Only dall-e-2 is supported at this time

n.text: The number of images to generate. Must be between 1 and 10. For dall-e-3, only n=1 is supported

size.text: The size of the generated images. Must be one of 256x256, 512x512, or 1024x1024

response_format.text: The format in which the generated images are returned. Must be one of url or b64_json. URLs are only valid for 60 minutes after the image has been generated

user.text: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse

meta.description: Creates a variation of a given image

model.text: ID of the model to use

description.text: The description of the assistant The maximum length is 512 characters

instructions.text: The system instructions that the assistant uses

tools.text: A list of tool enabled on the assistant

tool_resources.text: A set of resources that are used by the assistant's tools

metadata.text: Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object

temperature.text: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2

top_p.text: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass

response_format.text: Specifies the format that the model must output. Compatible with GPT-4o, GPT-4 Turbo, and all GPT-3.5 Turbo models since gpt-3.5-turbo-1106
